intro: Kageneckia lanceolata normalis, commonly known as the common kageneckia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as grasslands and wetlands. Its flowers are usually yellow to orange in color, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as cypselae. Kageneckia lanceolata normalis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
